FuncDef:
The te srlg command adds an interface to an SRLG.
The undo te srlg command removes an interface from an SRLG.
By default, an interface is not added to any SRLG.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an SRLG to which an interface joins.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Removes an interface from all SRLGs.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An SRLG, like the bandwidth and affinity attributes, is a constraint in TE path calculation. If an SRLG is configured for links, an IGP floods the TE link information along with the SRLG membership information to all devices in an IGP area. The SRLG membership information is then also added into the TEDB.
Precautions
MPLS TE-related commands apply only to MPLS TE and SR-MPLS TE. However, this command applies to SRv6 TE Policies, besides MPLS TE and SR-MPLS TE.
